meanings.definition: Causing or tending to cause deterioration.
meanings.sent1: The deteriorative weather damaged the old house.
meanings.sent2: The deteriorative effects of time can be seen on the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent3: The deteriorative impact of too much sun on ice cream is a melted mess.
meanings.sent4: The deteriorative nature of neglect on relationships can be heartbreaking.
meanings.sent5: The deteriorative power of rust on metal is relentless.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned building had a deteriorative appearance.
meanings.sent2: The deteriorative state of the road made driving difficult.
meanings.sent3: The deteriorative smell of spoiled food filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The deteriorative influence of negative thoughts can be harmful.
meanings.sent5: The deteriorative condition of the book made it unreadable.
